com.esri.mo2.client.io
Interface SimpleServiceProxy

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseSimpleServiceProxy
public interface SimpleServiceProxy

This is a client-side proxy for an IMS service.

An IMS service is a server object that can accept "state-less" client requests for data. A "state-less" client request is a single data request sent by a client via an OutputStream provided by the ServiceProxy's StatelessChannel. The client then receives the result of the request via an InputStream also provided by the ServiceProxy.

In order to be thread-safe, a ServiceProxy creates InputStream/OutputStream pairs whenever you invoke the getChannel method. These StatelessChannel objects should be used only once and discarded.

You can reuse a ServiceProxy for multiple services by changing the service name. To obtain information about a service invoke the getInfo method.

getServiceInfo

public String getServiceInfo()
                      throws IOException
Returns the service info for the currently named service. This method will block the current Thread while a round-trip request/response is made to the service.

Returns:
an ArcXML string for the service response
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if there is currently no name associated with the proxy
IOException - if an error is encountered
